work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

publications.name: Familiarity influences visual detection in a task that does not require explicit recognition
publications.summary: Roles: design experiments, program experiments in python and javascript, collect data, analyze data in R, write and submit manuscript

publications.name: Typical viewpoints of objects are better detected than atypical ones
publications.summary: Roles: collect data, analyze data in R, summarize the results

publications.name: Age difference in perceived ease of use, curiosity, and implicit negative attitude toward robots
publications.summary: Roles: collect data, summarize the results

publications.name: Subjective time expansion with increased stimulation of intrinsically photosensitive retinal ganglion cells
publications.summary: Roles: design experiments, program experiments in eprime, collect data, analyze data in R, write and submit manuscript

publications.name: Role of consciousness in temporal integration of semantic information
publications.summary: Roles: operate EEG and collect EEG data, EEG data pre-processing, edit manuscript

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
